workflow.name: Auto-create Geotab zone for new Salesforce work order
workflow.description:
### üìù DESCRIPTION OF THE WORKFLOW

This workflow connects Salesforce and Geotab to streamline fleet tracking for field service jobs (Work Orders). When a new Work Order is created in Salesforce (with a 'New' status and valid coordinates), it creates a circular geofence zone in Geotab and updates the Work Order with the zone ID. If geolocation is missing, an alert email is sent to dedicated email.

The workflow uses a Salesforce Outbound Message to trigger an n8n webhook. It includes robust credential handling and optional logic to skip or notify on bad data.

**Use Cases:**

* Automating vehicle geofence setup for service visits
* Enhancing CRM-to-fleet system synchronisation
* Enforcing work orders data quality via alerts

**Integrations Used:**

* Salesforce
* Geotab API
* Microsoft Outlook (or any SMTP-compatible service)

**Tags:**
`geotab`, `salesforce`, `fleet management`, `gps tracking`, `field service`, `crm`, `automation`, `webhook`, `integration`

---

**ADDITIONAL RESOURCES**
#### üîó **Salesforce**

* [Salesforce Login](https://login.salesforce.com/)
* \[Salesforce Setup (Admin Console)]\([https://login.salesforce.com/](https://login.salesforce.com/) ‚Üí click ‚ÄúSetup‚Äù gear icon)
* [Outbound Messages Documentation](https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=platform.workflow_managing_outbound_messages.htm)
* [Salesforce Developer Documentation](https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/)
* [Salesforce Workbench (API Testing Tool)](https://workbench.developerforce.com/)

---

#### üîó **Geotab**

* [Geotab Login (MyGeotab)](https://my.geotab.com/)
* [Geotab Developer Portal](https://developers.geotab.com/)
* [Geotab API Explorer](https://my.geotab.com/apiexplorer/)
* [Geotab SDK (JavaScript Samples)](https://developers.geotab.com/myGeotab/codeSamples/javascriptSamples)
* [Geotab Support Centre](https://support.geotab.com/)

---

workflow.name: Auto-Create Geotab Zone for New Salesforce Work Order

parameters.content:
## üõ∞Ô∏è Auto-Create Geotab Zone for New Salesforce Work Order

### üìå What this workflow does

This automation listens for new **Work Order (Job)** records created in **Salesforce**, and‚Äîif the record meets certain conditions‚Äîcreates a **geofence zone** in **Geotab** at the Work Order‚Äôs location.

It only triggers when:

* The Work Order has a `New` status
* There is **no existing Geotab Zone ID**
* The record contains **valid latitude and longitude**

After creating the zone, the workflow updates Salesforce with the Geotab Zone ID and sends a confirmation email. If no geo data is available, it notifies the Operations team.

**You can customise this workflow to your needs; for example change Salesforce Object (Opportunity, Account etc).**

### ‚öôÔ∏è Required Integrations
* ‚úÖ Salesforce (OAuth2)
* ‚úÖ Microsoft Outlook (for email notifications)
* ‚úÖ Geotab API access

parameters.jsonBody:
={
  "method": "Add",
  "params": {
    "typeName": "Zone",

    "entity": {
      "name": "{{ $('Prepare data for GeoTab').item.json.Name }}",
      "externalReference": "{{ $('Prepare data for GeoTab').item.json.ExternalReference }}",
      "reference": "{{ $('Prepare data for GeoTab').item.json.Reference }}",
      "comment": "{{ $('Prepare data for GeoTab').item.json.Comment }}",

      "groups": [
      {"id": "GroupCompanyId"}
      ],

      "activeFrom": "{{ $json.activeFrom }}",
      "activeTo": "{{ $json.activeTo }}",


      "points": [
        { "x": {{ $('Calculate points').item.json.result[0].longitude }}, "y": {{ $('Calculate points').item.json.result[0].latitude }}},
        { "x": {{ $('Calculate points').item.json.result[1].longitude }}, "y": {{ $('Calculate points').item.json.result[1].latitude }}},
        { "x": {{ $('Calculate points').item.json.result[2].longitude }}, "y": {{ $('Calculate points').item.json.result[2].latitude }}},
        { "x": {{ $('Calculate points').item.json.result[3].longitude }}, "y": {{ $('Calculate points').item.json.result[3].latitude }}},
        { "x": {{ $('Calculate points').item.json.result[4].longitude }}, "y": {{ $('Calculate points').item.json.result[4].latitude }}},
        { "x": {{ $('Calculate points').item.json.result[5].longitude }}, "y": {{ $('Calculate points').item.json.result[5].latitude }}},
        { "x": {{ $('Calculate points').item.json.result[6].longitude }}, "y": {{ $('Calculate points').item.json.result[6].latitude }}},
        { "x": {{ $('Calculate points').item.json.result[7].longitude }}, "y": {{ $('Calculate points').item.json.result[7].latitude }}},
        { "x": {{ $('Calculate points').item.json.result[8].longitude }}, "y": {{ $('Calculate points').item.json.result[8].latitude }}},
        { "x": {{ $('Calculate points').item.json.result[9].longitude }}, "y": {{ $('Calculate points').item.json.result[9].latitude }}},
        { "x": {{ $('Calculate points').item.json.result[10].longitude }}, "y": {{ $('Calculate points').item.json.result[10].latitude }}},
        { "x": {{ $('Calculate points').item.json.result[11].longitude }}, "y": {{ $('Calculate points').item.json.result[11].latitude }}},
        { "x": {{ $('Calculate points').item.json.result[12].longitude }}, "y": {{ $('Calculate points').item.json.result[12].latitude }}},
        { "x": {{ $('Calculate points').item.json.result[13].longitude }}, "y": {{ $('Calculate points').item.json.result[13].latitude }}},
        { "x": {{ $('Calculate points').item.json.result[14].longitude }}, "y": {{ $('Calculate points').item.json.result[14].latitude }}},
        { "x": {{ $('Calculate points').item.json.result[15].longitude }}, "y": {{ $('Calculate points').item.json.result[15].latitude }}},
        { "x": {{ $('Calculate points').item.json.result[16].longitude }}, "y": {{ $('Calculate points').item.json.result[16].latitude }}},
        { "x": {{ $('Calculate points').item.json.result[17].longitude }}, "y": {{ $('Calculate points').item.json.result[17].latitude }}},
        { "x": {{ $('Calculate points').item.json.result[18].longitude }}, "y": {{ $('Calculate points').item.json.result[18].latitude }}},
        { "x": {{ $('Calculate points').item.json.result[19].longitude }}, "y": {{ $('Calculate points').item.json.result[19].latitude }}}
      ],

      "visibleOnMap": true,
      "publishToGroups": [1],
      "showStopsInArea": true
    },

    "credentials": {
      "sessionId": "{{ $('GeoTab authentication').item.json.result.credentials.sessionId }}",
      "database": "YOUR_GEOTAB_DATABASE_NAME",
      "userName": "YOUR@EMAIL.COM"
    }
  }
}

parameters.content:
## ‚ö†Ô∏è Missing Geolocation in Salesforce

This branch sends an email notification when a Work Order is missing latitude and longitude.
You can delete this section alongside "If has location node" if your Salesforce trigger already excludes such records.

parameters.subject: =Job zone was created for job number {{ $('Get Work Order details').item.json.WorkOrderNumber }}
=Action Required: Missing Geo Location for Job  {{ $('Get Work Order details').item.json.WorkOrderNumber }}

parameters.content:
### üîê Credentials to configure

You must connect or edit the following credentials:

* üîπ **Salesforce Account**

  * Nodes: `Get Work Order details`, `Update Salesforce with zone details`

* üîπ **Outlook Account**

  * Nodes: `Email notification - success`, `Email notification - error`

* üîπ **Geotab API**

  * Node: `GeoTab authentication`

    * Replace `userName`, `password`, and `database` fields in the JSON body
  * Node: `Create zone in GeoTab`

    * Update the same values at the end of the JSON body (`database`, `userName`)

### üß© How the Salesforce trigger works

This workflow is triggered by **an Outbound Message from Salesforce**.

In Salesforce Setup, you can configure an **Outbound Message** tied to the **Work Order** object. When a new Work Order is created (or meets specific criteria), Salesforce sends a SOAP request to this workflow's **Webhook URL**.

The workflow starts by receiving this message and extracting the Work Order ID to retrieve full details using the Salesforce node.

### ‚ö†Ô∏è Setup Required in Salesforce

1. Go to **Setup ‚Üí Outbound Messages**
2. Create a new Outbound Message for the **Work Order** object
3. Add fields as needed (at minimum, `Id`)
4. Paste the Webhook URL from the **Salesforce Webhook** node in this workflow
5. Link the Outbound Message to a Workflow Rule or Flow that fires when a **new Work Order is created**

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
